name: AzureParallelDeploy
description: Simplify your pipeline and minimize service deploy time by deploying multiple services to Azure Portal in parallel.
author: Stano Pe≈•ko

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure resource manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: ResourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resource group name in Azure Portal.

inputs.name: AppType
inputs.label: Application type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of deployed applications. All deployed applications must be of the same type. The value is either `WebApp` or `FunctionApp`. If the value is not set or is invalid, `WebApp` is used.

inputs.name: Services
inputs.label: Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma separated values of logical service names. These names are used for generating real service names in Azure Portal and names of source ZIP files.

inputs.name: AppNameFormat
inputs.label: Azure application name format string
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format string for app service name in Azure Portal. Format string accepts one parameter `{0}`, which will be replaced by the logical name of the service. For example if format string is `prod-{0}-api` and logical service name is `forecast`, the application will be deployed to `prod-forecast-api` app service. If the value is not set, `{0}` format string will be used (the name of the service in Azure Portal is the same as logical service name).

inputs.name: AppSourceFormat
inputs.label: Application source file format string
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format string for path to source ZIP files for services. Every service is deployed from single ZIP file. The format string accepts one parameter `{0}`, which will be replace by the logical name of the service. For example if format string is `{0}-api.zip` and logical service name is `forecast`, source file name will be `forecast-api.zip`. `zip` extension must be specified expplicitly. If the value is not set, `{0}.zip` format string will be used (source file name is the same as logical service name with `zip` extension).

inputs.name: AppSourceBasePath
inputs.label: Applications' sources base path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Base path for services' source files. Service source zip file is searched recursively in this folder. If the value is not set, the default value is used based on the build type. If it is general build, `Build.StagingDirectory` value is used. If it is any other build type (release, deployment...) `System.DefaultWorkingDirectory` is used. Build type is determined by the `System.HostType` variable.

inputs.name: SlotName
inputs.label: Slot name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the slot for deployment. The slot name is used for all deployed services.
